channel.title: Build.bat error
channel.description:
Hello guys I am back to rsps, using windows 7 now instead of windows vista. having a little issue compiling a pi source though.
[code]@echo off javac -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\quests\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java src\server\model\content\*.java src\server\clip\*.java src\server\clip\region\*.java pause[/code]
that is the build.bat how it came and this is my directionality
[code]C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\java.exe[/code]
and it should work like this
[code]@echo off "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\java.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\quests\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java src\server\model\content\*.java src\server\clip\*.java src\server\clip\region\*.java pause[/code]
but alas it is telling me option -d could not create the vitrual machine, i have gotten the client side compiling and running...but this side.. no go

item.title: Build.bat error
item.dc:creator: @TheProdigy TheProdigy
item.description:
@TheProdigy wrote:

Good But I’d still recommend getting an IDE to work, preferably Eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: Build.bat error
item.dc:creator: @emtrescue emtrescue
item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

IDE didn’t work either. tried to reply but you’re post was delete. my issue didnt lay in the .bat file it layed in the downloading, computer didn’t download all the files. i went to reget the .bat out of the archived file and it gave me an error, i redownloaded, as redownloading i noticed the file SRC was missing. works perfect now.

Read full topic

item.title: Build.bat error
item.dc:creator: @TheProdigy TheProdigy
item.description:
@TheProdigy wrote:

I would recommend using an IDE as it builds the source for you.

Read full topic

item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

Yes, i have tried that but that attempt along with javaw, have failed, it tells me with javac

item.title: Build.bat error
item.dc:creator: @emtrescue emtrescue
item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

Hello guys I am back to rsps, using windows 7 now instead of windows vista. having a little issue compiling a pi source though.

@echo off javac -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\quests\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java src\server\model\content\*.java src\server\clip\*.java src\server\clip\region\*.java pause
